body: since this is an optional dtype currently there are number of edge cases - welcome a PR to fix this

I think we have other issues about replace on extension arrays. Can you
search for them and close this issue if you find a duplicate?

On Mon, Feb 25, 2019 at 4:50 AM Robin Linderborg <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Code Sample
>
> df = pd.DataFrame({
>     'a': [1, 2, 3, np.nan],
>     'b': ['some', 'strings', 'here', 'he']
> })
>
> df['a'] = df['a'].astype('Int64')
>
> df.replace('', np.nan).dtypes  # Column a is now float
>
> Problem description
>
> The new Int64Dtype does not behave as expected here. If you do a global
> replacement of empty strings to NaN's, it seems weird that this would have
> the side effect of casting ints to floats.
> Expected Output
>
> Expected:
>
> a     Int64
> b    object
> dtype: object
>
> Output of pd.show_versions() INSTALLED VERSIONS
